comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Looks like Oscar Straus, the politician, as in other photos in this series, (not "G. Staus" as in title.). Amb. Straus was the Bull Moose Party candidate for governor of New York in 1912. Also in the picture is Lucien L. Bonheur, Chairman of the Nassau County Committee of the Progressive Party (Bull Moose).

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information about Straus and Bonheur.  We'll add the changes to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: This was a reception for Bull Moose gubernatorial candidate Oscar Straus and Mrs. Straus, at Bourke Cockran's residence in Port Washington, Long Island, on September 28, 1912, to kick off the Bull Moose (Progressive Party) campaign in Nassau County. New York Times story on the Lawn Fete for Oscar Straus, September 29, 1912: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9F04EFD9113AE6... Other Bain/LOC photos of the Lawn Fete for Oscar Straus: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515739507/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515739229/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2516555780/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2516557862/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515733737/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515733049/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2516556066/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2516556764/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2516556980/in/photostream/] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2515732783/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: Mr. Cockran's name is misspelled in your title and in Bain's as well.

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/70251312@N00] Bain misspelled Cockran's name in all the related photos.  We're sorting it out.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Bourke Cockran, a prominent New York criminal lawyer, served as Lt. Charles Becker's defense attorney, in the 1914 retrial of the notorious "Killer Cop." (Becker was found guilty, and executed in 1915.)
